main event: A series of unidentified objects were sighted in the sky over Snowmass, Colorado, on June 3, 1960, and December 18, 1963.
interesting points: The objects were observed over a duration of about 5 minutes on June 3, 1960, and for at least an hour on December 18, 1963., The objects were reported to be dark orange or red in color., One witness mentioned observing the objects through field glasses., A neighbor 5 miles away also reported seeing similar objects., The Air Force concluded the sightings might be balloons or aircraft and requested more details.
witness description: A couple who observed the objects, with a neighbor also witnessing them from a distance.
